The platform emphasises comprehensive documentation describing and contextualising each dataset with worked examples on how to incorporate data into CSID models. ::: ::: {.home-buttons} [Browse Data Sources](/radar/data.qmd){.btn-browse .btn-action-primary .btn-action .btn .btn-success .btn-lg role="button"} [Learn More](/radar/about.qmd){#btn-about .btn-action .btn .btn-info .btn-lg role="button"} ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {#data-image} ![](img/browse_datasources.png) ::: ::: ::: ::: ::: ::: {#principles-block .content-block .column-screen} ::: {#principles-heading .hero-text} Guidelines for Data Inclusion ::: ::: {.principles .column-page} ::: {layout-ncol=3} ::: {.principle} ### Accessible Data showcased on Health RADAR is available and accessible to users already. ::: ::: {.principle} ### Befitting A technical expert group audits the data to ensure it aligns with CSID modelling and excludes sensitive or potentially harmful information. ::: ::: {.principle} ### Cited A suggested citation must be included so that the source and transformations of the data are adequately acknowledged. ::: ::: {.principle} ### Documented The original data collection methods and the context in which the data may be correctly interpreted will be presented alongside the data to facilitate onward responsible use. ::: ::: {.principle} ### Exemplified To catalyse the use of the data in CSID modelling, example code snippets will be provided to incorporate datasets into CSID models. ::: ::: {.principle} ### Exemplified 2 To catalyse the use of the data in CSID modelling, example code snippets will be provided to incorporate datasets into CSID models. ::: ::: ::: ::: ::: {#browse-btn-block .content-block .column-screen} ::: {.column-page} [Browse Data Sources](/radar/data.qmd){.btn-browse .btn-action-primary .btn-action .btn .btn-success .btn-lg role="button" style="margin-top: 1em;"} ::: :::
